Basic modules for interacting with the Graph Stuctures¶

This are the basic models.

class drivers.graph_models.Elevation[source]¶

Methods

class drivers.graph_models.Occurrence(filtered_nodes)[source]¶

Lets see hoe this works

Methods

getAncestors(depth=8)[source]¶

Given the parameter depth it walks through the Subgraph Taxonomy Starting from the Occurrence Node to the depth specified. Remember that there is a loop in the LUCA node there fore,

getCells()[source]¶

Returns all the cells that are associated with this taxa. Occurrence is the Leaf Node of the Tree Of life, therefore It gives the real cell where it was found.

isDescendantOf(ancestor, depth=8)[source]¶

Ancestor is a tree node. Returns True if this occurrence has ‘ancestor’ in some level of it’s Ancestors chain.

pullbackRasterNodes(raster_name)[source]¶

Returns the associated value of each occurrence based on the available models.

class drivers.graph_models.RasterNode[source]¶

Super class for each node.

Methods

class drivers.graph_models.TreeNode[source]¶

Attributes

Methods

allOccurrences¶

Retrieve all data! related to this taxonimic node.

cells¶

Returns all the cells that are associated with this taxa. Does not take into account the current leaf nodes in the TreeNode. It gives all the nodes of type cell where this node has been found in all the database.

getAssociatedTrees()[source]¶

Returns a list of trees for each of the cells where the Node has events

getUpperScaleCells()[source]¶

si mira, te vengo manejando lo que es el m’etodo para obtener las celdas a una resoluci’on espacial mayor. La inmediata superior.

Returns list of upper scale cells.

insideCellRatio(cells_list=”, option=1)[source]¶

Scales Calculates the inside cell ratio for all scales Returns list of ratios

parameters:
option : 1
returns ratios
option : 2
returns true values (number of cells)
propagateCells(cells_list=”)[source]¶

Extracts the cells by going upstream in the scales. It uses the POSET structure of the Quadtree.

setLabel(labelname)[source]¶

Usefull when selecting arbitrary nodes of certain taxonomy.
